meanings.definition: To engage in a close fight or struggle without weapons; wrestle.
meanings.sent1: The two friends grappled playfully on the grass.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler grapples with his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The kitten grapples with a ball of yarn, thinking it's a foe.
meanings.sent4: She grapples with her fear of heights every time she climbs a ladder.
meanings.sent5: The hero grapples with the villain in an epic battle.

meanings.definition: To struggle with or work hard to deal with or overcome a problem.
meanings.sent1: He grapples with his math homework every night.
meanings.sent2: The team grapples with the challenge of winning the championship.
meanings.sent3: She grapples with the decision of what to wear to the party.
meanings.sent4: The detective grapples with solving the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The student grapples with understanding the complex science concept.

meanings.definition: A device consisting of an iron hook, either fixed or movable, for grabbing and holding.
meanings.sent1: The pirate used a grapple to climb aboard the ship.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter carried a grapple to rescue people from the burning building.
meanings.sent3: The robot's arm extended with a grapple to pick up the fallen object.
meanings.sent4: The climber secured himself with a grapple to the rocky cliff.
meanings.sent5: The construction worker used a grapple to lift heavy materials.
